Patent Information.Abstract: An antimicrobial peptide containing at least the following amino acid sequence, or a derivative thereof, an antimicrobial agent containing said antimicrobial peptide or a derivative thereof as active components at a concentration of at least 1 µM, an antimicrobial composition containing said antimicrobial peptide or a derivative thereof, and a method for processing products which uses the antimicrobial agent containing at least said antimicrobial peptide or a derivative thereof: EQU A--X--A (where, A is an arginine residue or a lysine residue; and X is an amino acid sequence comprising at least from three to nine arbitrary amino acid residues other than cysteine residues).

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.29984236] Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 33591 (MIC=100 μg/ml; MBC=199 μg/ml)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.29984236] 3% hemolysis at 5 μM, 5% hemolysis at 12 μM, 5% hemolysis at 22 μM, 0% hemolysis at 50 μM, 2% hemolysis at 100 μM against human red blood cell.[Ref.29551999] 7.1% hemolysis at 25μM, 50% hemolysis at >100μM against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against the Gram-negative bacteria and Gram-positive bacteria. Has hemolytic activity.

Literature.Title: Effect of Polyvalence on the Antibacterial Activity of a Synthetic Peptide Derived from Bovine Lactoferricin against Healthcare-Associated Infectious Pathogens.
Literature.Author: Sandra C. Vega Chaparro, J. Tatiana Valencia Salguero, Diana A. Mart

Literature.Title: Design, Synthesis and Evaluation of Branched RRWQWR-Based Peptides as Antibacterial Agents against Clinically Relevant Gram-Positive and Gram-Negative Pathogens
Literature.Author: Nguyen LT, Chau JK, Perry NA, de Boer L, Zaat SA, Vogel HJ

Literature.Title: Serum stabilities of short tryptophan- and arginine-rich antimicrobial peptide analogs
